intro: Jumellea intricata, commonly known as the intricate jumellea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant features narrow, opposite leaves and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Jumellea intricata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
